intro: Ozoroa aurantiaca, commonly known as the golden flame tree, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Bignoniaceae family and is characterized by its striking, bright yellow flowers that bloom in clusters. The plant produces long, narrow leaves and has a distinctive, branching structure. It is often cultivated for its ornamental value due to its vibrant blooms and adaptability to various soil types. Ozoroa aurantiaca is also valued in traditional medicine for its potential health benefits.
